Wisdom: الصَّوَابُ مِنْ فُروعِ الرَّوِيَّةِ
enWisdom: Correctness is one of the branches of deliberation

Wisdom: الظَّفَرُ بِالْحَزْمِ وَالْحَزْمُ بِالتَّجَارِبِ
enWisdom: Victory is [attained] by prudence, and prudence comes through experience

Wisdom: إِذَا اقْتَرَنَ الْعَزْمُ بِالْحَزْمِ كَمُلَتِ السَّعَادَةُ
enWisdom: When judiciousness is coupled with determination, felicity becomes complete

Wisdom: ثَمَرَةُ الْحَزْمِ السَّلَامَةُ
enWisdom: The fruit of judiciousness is wellbeing

Wisdom: خُذْ بِالْحَزْمِ وَالْزَمِ الْعِلْمَ تُحْمَدْ عَوَاقِبُكَ
enWisdom: Act with judiciousness and cling to knowledge your results will be praiseworthy

Wisdom: الْحَزْمُ شِدَّةُ الِاسْتِظْهَارِ
enWisdom: Judiciousness is being extremely cautious

Wisdom: سِلَاحُ الْحَازِمِ الِاسْتِظْهَارُ
enWisdom: The weapon of a judicious person is precaution

Wisdom: مَنْ أَخَذَ بِالْحَزْمِ اسْتَظْهَرَ
enWisdom: One who acts judiciously is cautious

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يُقَدِّمْهُ الْحَزْمُ أَخَّرَهُ الْعَجْزُ
enWisdom: One who is not pushed forward by judiciousness is held back by impuissance

Wisdom: أَلَا وَإِنَّ مَنْ تَوَرَّطَ فِي الْأُمُورِ مِنْ غَيْرِ [بِغَيْرِ] نَظَرٍ فِي الْعَوَاقِبِ فَقَدْ تَعَرَّضَ لِمُفْدِحَاتِ النَّوَائِبِ
enWisdom: Indeed, the one who gets involved in matters without thinking about the consequences is vulnerable to grave calamities

Wisdom: الْحَازِمُ يَقْظَانُ الْغَافِلُ وَسْنَانُ
enWisdom: The judicious one is alert, the negligent one is sleepy

Wisdom: التَّأَيُّدُ [التَّأْيِيدُ] حَزْمٌ
enWisdom: Strengthening oneself is [a sign of] judiciousness

Wisdom: الْحَازِمُ مَنْ دَارَى زَمَانَهُ
enWisdom: The judicious person is one who is amicable with [the people of] his time

Wisdom: الْحَازِمُ مَنِ اطَّرَحَ الْمُؤَنَ وَالْكُلَفَ
enWisdom: The judicious person is one who discards [excessive] expenses and luxuries

Wisdom: الْحَزْمُ حِفْظُ مَا كُلِّفْتَ وَتَرْكُ مَا كُفِيتَ
enWisdom: Judiciousness is safeguarding that which you have been charged with and leaving that which has been guaranteed for you

Wisdom: الْحَازِمُ مَنْ دَارَى زَمَانَهُ
enWisdom: The judicious person is one who is amicable with [the people of] his time

Wisdom: الْحَزْمُ تَجَرُّعُ الْغُصَّةِ حَتَّى تَمَكَّنَ الْفُرْصَةُ
enWisdom: Judiciousness means enduring agony until the opportunity [to react] avails itself

Wisdom: الْحَازِمُ مَنْ لَا يَشْغَلُهُ النِّعْمَةُ عَنِ الْعَمَلِ لِلْعَاقِبَةِ
enWisdom: The judicious person is one who does not get too preoccupied with the blessing [he has been given] to work for his afterlife

Wisdom: الْحَزْمُ النَّظَرُ فِي الْعَوَاقِبِ وَمُشَاوَرَةُ ذَوِي الْعُقُولِ
enWisdom: Judiciousness is considering the consequences [of actions] and consulting the wise

Wisdom: الْحَازِمُ مَنْ جَادَ بِمَا فِي يَدِهِ وَلَمْ يُؤَخِّرْ [لَا يُؤَخِّرُ] عَمَلَ يَوْمِهِ إِلَى غَدِهِ
enWisdom: The judicious person is one who is generous with what he has in his possession and does not postpone his work of today to tomorrow

Wisdom: الْحَازِمُ مَنْ لَمْ يَشْغَلْهُ غُرُورُ دُنْيَاهُ عَنِ الْعَمَلِ لِأُخْرَاهُ [لِآخِرَتِهِ‏]
enWisdom: The judicious person is one who is not too preoccupied with the deceptions of his world to work for his Hereafter

Wisdom: الْحَازِمُ مَنْ تَخَيَّرَ لِخُلَّتِهِ فَإِنَّ الْمَرْءَ يُوزَنُ بِخَلِيلِهِ
enWisdom: The truthful friend is one who advises you of your faults protects your dignity in your absence and gives you preference over himself

Wisdom: الْحَازِمُ مَنْ حَنَّكَتْهُ التَّجَارِبُ وَهَذَّبَتْهُ النَّوَائِبُ
enWisdom: The judicious person is one who has been made worldly-wise by experience and refined by calamities

Wisdom: الْحَازِمُ مَنْ شَكَرَ النِّعْمَةَ مُقْبِلَةً وَصَبَرَ عَنْهَا وَسَلَاهَا مُوَلِّيَةً مُدْبِرَةً [مُدْبِرَةً مُوَلِّيَةً]
enWisdom: The judicious person is one who gives thanks for blessings that come to him and is patient and thinks no more of it when the blessings turn away or turn back from him

Wisdom: الْحَازِمُ مَنْ يُؤَخِّرُ الْعُقُوبَةَ فِي سُلْطَانِ الْغَضَبِ وَيُعَجِّلُ مُكَافَاةَ الْإِحْسَانِ اغْتِنَاماً لِفُرْصَةِ الْإِمْكَانِ
enWisdom: The judicious person is one who delays meting out punishment when [he is] under the yoke of anger and expedites the repayment of favours by taking advantage of the available opportunity

Wisdom: أَحْزَمُكُمْ أَزْهَدُكُمْ
enWisdom: The most judicious of you is the most abstemious of you [from worldly pleasures]

Wisdom: أَحْزَمُ النَّاسِ مَنِ اسْتَهَانَ بِأَمْرِ دُنْيَاهُ
enWisdom: The most judicious of all people is one who deems his worldly affairs to be unimportant

Wisdom: أَحْزَمُ النَّاسِ مَنْ تَوَهَّمَ الْعَجْزَ لِفَرْطِ اسْتِظْهَارِهِ
enWisdom: The most judicious of people is the one who presumes his inability despite having numerous supporters

Wisdom: أَحْزَمُ النَّاسِ رَأْياً مَنْ أَنْجَزَ وَعْدَهُ وَلَمْ يُؤَخِّرْ عَمَلَ يَوْمِهِ لِغَدِهِ
enWisdom: The most judicious of people is the one who fulfils his promise and does not postpone his work of today to tomorrow

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْحَازِمَ مَنْ لَا يَغْتَرُّ بِالْخُدَعِ
enWisdom: Indeed the judicious person is one who does not get beguiled by deceptions

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْحَازِمَ مَنْ شَغَلَ نَفْسَهُ بِجِهَادِ نَفْسِهِ فَأَصْلَحَهَا وَحَبَسَهَا عَنْ أَهْوِيَتِهَا وَلَذَّاتِهَا فَمَلَكَهَا وَإِنَّ لِلْعَاقِلِ بِنَفْسِهِ عَنِ الدُّنْيَا وَمَا فِيهَا وَأَهْلِهَا شُغُلًا
enWisdom: Verily the judicious person is one who occupies himself with struggling against his [lower] self, thereby rectifying it and preventing it from indulging in its vain desires and pleasures, thus he attains mastery over it; and verily for the intelligent one there is a preoccupation in keeping himself away from [that which is impermissible of] this world, its contents and its people

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْحَازِمَ مَنْ قَيَّدَ نَفْسَهُ بِالْمُحَاسَبَةِ وَمَلَكَهَا بِالْمُغَاضَبَةِ وَقَتَلَهَا بِالْمُجَاهَدَةِ
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا الْحَزْمُ طَاعَةُ اللَّهِ وَمَعْصِيَةُ النَّفْسِ
enWisdom: Verily judiciousness is only in obedience to Allah and disobedience to the [lower] self

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا الْحَازِمُ مَنْ كَانَ بِنَفْسِهِ كُلُّ شُغُلِهِ وَلِدِينِهِ كُلُّ هَمِّهِ وَلِآخِرَتِهِ كُلُّ جِدِّهِ
enWisdom: Only he is judicious whose preoccupation is entirely with himself, whose concern is entirely for his religion, and whose struggle is entirely for his Hereafter

Wisdom: بِإِصَابَةِ الرَّأْيِ يَقْوَى الْحَزْمُ
enWisdom: Through correct opinion (or prudence), ones judiciousness is strengthened

Wisdom: قِلَّةُ الِاسْتِرْسَالِ إِلَى النَّاسِ أَحْزَمُ
enWisdom: Confiding less in people [and not telling them your secrets] is more judicious

Wisdom: مِنَ الْحَزْمِ الْوُقُوفُ عِنْدَ الشُّبْهَةِ
enWisdom: Stopping [and assessing the situation] when faced with doubt is part of judiciousness

Wisdom: نِعْمَ الْحَزْمُ الِاسْتِظْهَارُ
enWisdom: How good a foresight precaution is!

Wisdom: لَا يَدْهَشُ عِنْدَ الْبَلَاءِ الْحَازِمُ
enWisdom: The judicious one does not become perplexed in times of adversity

Wisdom: لَا يَكُونُ حَازِماً مَنْ لَا يَجُودُ بِمَا فِي يَدِهِ‏ وَ لَا يُؤَخِّرُ عَمَلَ يَوْمِهِ إِلَى غَدِهِ
enWisdom: He who does not give generously from what he has and does not advance (or save) his work of today for his morrow is not a judicious person
